messages.message:
Potential UX improvement:
When editing a field / class, it's helpful to see one of the documents being displayed. But when I click on the class / field, it hides the document from the view. Is there a reason for it or is this a bug?
are these documents classified under the class you selected?
If not then this is the expected ux atm
They are not yet classified at all
Why do we hide it if they are not same class?
if the documents aren’t in that class then showing them is not useful to the user as the class/fields don’t apply to those documents.
What about when the documents have not been classified like in the above case? The alternative is just an empty screen, so I don’t think hiding the document is adding any value
you could save your class changes first -> wait for the documents to be reclassified -> when you select a class, an associated document will be shown

if the documents have not been classified yet, how will the frontend know which document to arbitrarily choose to show? i think this interface would be even more confusing and hard to explain to a user

If no documents have been classified yet on a new project and the user is editing the achema the choice is between:
1. Leave the open document on the screen
2. Remove it and show “no documents selected”
I was thinking removing it from the screen was unnecessary, but it makes sense if this is just an instance of showing the document in the class being edited
Why I brought it up is because it confused me at first why it was disappearing when I was editing the schema without saving the classes

hmm actually we should treat all these unclassified docs as having the extraction class, right? so we should continue showing the open document on the screen?

@CJ will your upcoming refactor changes fix this, since we’ll always refer to the class label from `useClassify`, not `useDocuments`?
yay that should implement exactly your suggestion then! @Sayd
